triples.evidence: SLIDE_TEXT: You begin by applying a 90-degree RF pulse to select a specific slice of tissue, as shown in the figure.

concepts.term: signal collected from it contains contributions from all the chemical compounds present there

evidence: Now let's look at one of the two methods used in MRI spectroscopy - the PRESS method, which stands for Point-Resolved Spectroscopy. This method is commonly used to acquire the MR spectrum from a single voxel - that is, a small three-dimensional volume within the body.
triples.o: an NMR spectrum from a single voxel
